name: Rothay Manor Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent two days at Rothay Manor Hotel. Stayed in a superior room which was excellent and well worth paying the extra. Staff could not have been more pleasant and friendly.
reviews.title: "Excellent Hotel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: All the meals we had were excellent and would certainly return.
reviews.title: Very relaxing birthday weekend - also our third visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited for the weekend with family. We all felt happy with our rooms especially those overlooking the garden. The bathroom in the room at the back needed a little t.l.c.
reviews.title: 2nd visit - good as the first.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The two small lounges are really comfortable, however agree with a previous reviewer that the dining rooms need updating. However they are very nicely set out.
reviews.title: just an evening meal.
Afternoon tea
reviews.text: Our food I.e. breakfast and evening meals on both days were excellent. The food was of excellent quality and beautifully presented. There were a lovely selection of dishes to choose. No complaints from any of us. There was a nice cooked breakfast menu, however, I do not always want a cooked breakfast and thought that perhaps some bread rolls and ham/cheese would be nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely welcome, best we've ever had - friendly but not intrusive. Lovely room, very clean and private with balcony. Breakfast was so pleasant and peaceful, highly organised but relaxed atmosphere.
reviews.title: Brilliant and we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing too much trouble, really lovely staff.
reviews.title: Thank you for a lovely break - we will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very pleasant stay for two days to celebrate our ruby wedding anniversary at Rothay Manor and couldn't fault this hotel. Room 3 was fabulous, lovely views of the garden from the balcony. Food was exceptional - beautifully presented - our only gripe is the fact that we missed the famous afternoon tea due to the fact that we walked further than anticipated, however we shall make a point of sampling this feast the next time we return.
reviews.title: THE BEST AFTERNOON TEA EVER! Staff were wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you very much for acknowleding our wedding anniversay, this was a lovely gesture, never to be forgotten.
reviews.title: superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited Rothay Manor today 5th August 2011. For a pre-birthday afternoon tea. Me and my partner arrived a little early for our booking but the staff were amazing and managed to squeeze us in, the lounges were tastefully but classically yet modernly decorated with comfortable seating. The temperature was lovely and cool inside on such a warm day outside but it was very comfortable, not chilly at all! The quality of the furnishings and the crockery and cutlery was outstanding and the food was mind blowing, the sweet desert and cake selection was outstanding, there was carrot cake, chocolate cake, poppy and lemon cake, cherry cake, Victoria sandwich cake plus more, The chocolate parkin type fridge biscuit was delicious and I'm sure i could taste a little tipple of rum in it, i wish I'd asked for a doggy bag, there was various tea types and coffee types on offer and afternoon tea could be eaten in the garden on the nice day it was or in either of the two spacious lounges, the sandwiches were so lovely with an array of fillings on white and wholemeal bread both vegi and meat option, and the savouries and apple and pork pie were to die for, the buffet style afternoon tea was the best idea afternoon tea has been served at as it meant you were not restricted to what you could have and how much you could have, you were asked if you needed any top ups or re-fills of teas and were allowed even to change your tea during your meal. You were encouraged to go back to the buffet tables for more food as you wished and it was not something to feel embarrassed about just topping up plate after plate! The chocolate mouse was delicious and so light the meringue nests were pink my favorite colour and had fresh bream and strawberries on them they were crunchy on the outside but still chewy on the inside perfection its self! There was cream butter and various jams and lemon curd with the scones of which there was a choice of Fruit or plain and these could be heated if required by the staff. I have to say the staff were wonderful, so attentive but not the type where you felt bothered every moment. The young man serving the tea and coffee was such a pleasure to be served by, and was available when needed even though the garden was busy outside too. All in all this day was wonderful and i will definatly be making this a birthday tradition to go to Rothay for Afternoon tea. and the price is a bargain compared to other local places who charge more and offer less! This is the best afternoon tea i have had by miles, just want more of that pie YUM YUM!!!!!! Thanks for a great day to remember!
reviews.title: We were two happy bunnies.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with a two day break (via Travelzoo) staying at Rothay Manor. The quality of the food and the service was first class. Our standard room was a good size, the bed was very comfortable and the housekeeping staff were zealous in their duties. The centre of Ambleside was an easy, er, amble from the hotel and we enjoyed several good walks in the nearby valleys. Plenty of parking space and nicely maintained gardens at the front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were nice touches when dining at night with the families with young children occupying a separate section of the dining area from other guests. Very welcome.
reviews.title: Excellent food and attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Minor cavils? Well the main dining room needs a refurb, especially the vile French Mustard colour on the walls, the good wine list is rather too Bordeaux/Burgundy centric for our liking (though there is an adequate choice from other countries) and the wine glasses themselves in both the dining room and the bar don't do the better wines justice. ...definite need for some Riedel or Schott Zwiesel there. None of these detracted from a very enjoyable stay and we'd be very pleased to return.
reviews.title: Very good indeed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: A final note, the Post code in your SatNav can easily lead you to the wrong hotel as the code covers more than one hotel. Best to approach the Hotel via the A5095.
reviews.title: Lovely Afternoon Tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my husband to the Rothay Manor for his birthday. We were very impressed with the food and the attentiveness of the staff. The selection of food for breakfast was excellent and every thing was very fresh. Finnan haddock was a treat for breakfast and the home baked bread at dinner time was delicious.
reviews.title: Can't fault it - a lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Very pleasant stay for 3 nights on a Travel Zoo deal. The hotel and clientele were as expected and a very similar experience to a previous stay 13 years ago at another 3 star hotel in Ambleside.
reviews.title: Also expected to find Miss Marple....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large with seating area and very pleasant if a little dated. The bathroom could have been better. The shower produced a trickle of water & was really not up
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to standard for a 3 star hotel. The bath panel didn't fit properly.
reviews.title: Worth a return visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food did make up for these shortcomings. The dinner each evening was excellent and coffee with petit fours in the lounge after really made it an enjoyable evening.
reviews.title: Perfect place to relax and enjoy good food and brilliant service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was as expected but a 7:30 start would have suited us better.
reviews.title: A classic English country hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard of accommodation is excellent. The location is a five minute walk from the centre of Ambleside or similar distance to the Ambleside ferry terminal.
reviews.title: Weekend Break in Lake District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is first class with good selection of wines from house wines £19 per bottle to fine wines.
reviews.title: Wonderful food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free use of Leisure facilities at the Salutation Hotel (centre of Ambleside) which are excellent, gym, pool, sauna, steam room and outdoor hot tub. Towels and locker key available from Rothay Manor, just ask at reception
reviews.title: Trip No Two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 14th and 15th Feb 2013. The staff at the Rothay are welcoming, friendly and efficient; the service is very good. The room allocated to us was pleasant and comfortable and cleaned and tidied each morning before we returned from an excellent breakfast. The dining room is a little on the drab side and lacks ambiance somewhat but the food and service in it is of a very hight standard so don't be tempted to go in search of a restaurant as you won't find better food. The only slight niggle ( my partner's) is that eggs benedict wasn't on the breakfast menu but you can' have everything! We will be very happy to return.
reviews.title: afternoon tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second visit to the Rothay Manor, and hope it won't be our last.
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Rothay Manor for two nights for our anniversary. For a traditional Lakeland experience, it would be very hard to beat. We had a large, comfortable room on the ground floor: all the facilities were excellent. The food was first class: a very varied menu, beautifully presented and with very generous portions. The evening meal started with canapes in the bar, continued with a three course meal and finished with coffee and petit fours - if you still had room for them. Breakfast was equally good - choice of a Cumberland platter (their version of full English ), or lighter options like kippers.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were invariably friendly and helpful. We asked advice about things like the best way to get into the village, and boat timetables, and they were always very obliging.
reviews.title: Cosy Place and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotels is set in very pleasant grounds, and is equally convenient for Lake Windermere, Ambleside, or local walks. Overall it has a lot going for it, and we would certainly come back another time.
reviews.title: The Best Afternoon Tea In The Lakes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed almost a fortnight between end of June and Mid-July.
reviews.title: " Hot and bothered in Ambleside "

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though the lovely garden is surrounded by two (little bit noisy) roads it is a very relaxing and wonderful place to take an afternoon tea (which is a must have) or just read a book. The Restaurant within the hotel offers a daily changing variety of local fresh food and a good quality.
reviews.title: Just like home - with a difference!
Slipping, ever so steadily, to a lower class
reviews.text: This hotel has figured in every edition of the Good Hotel Guide since the inception of that publication and regularly lists highly on Trip Advisor reviews but on our second visit here it was becoming very apparent that there are better hotels in the Lake District for the prices that this hotel is charging.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 18 months ago we said that the decor in the Dining Room was jaded with ceiling roses that looked adrift from the ceiling, a muddy brown base colour on the walls, scorch marks on the ceiling from the wall lamps and wine glassware out of keeping with the products on offer.
reviews.title: Close to perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In response to these observations the 'Management' said that it hoped to improve the Dining Room decor during a refurbishment in Jan 2012. Looking through previous reviews of the hotel we have noted that similar observations on the decor to ours were made in 2010 when the 'Management' promised action in the Jan 2011 refurbishment. When we booked for this break back in November 2012 we asked if the Dining Room refurbishment had been undertaken and were told that the 'powers that be' didn't deem it necessary. In isolation one might forgive this attitude but unfortunately it has extended to other reaches of the hotel. It's a fair bet that this is the only hotel in the Lake District charging the thick end of £120 a night for a room that still provides only 50/50 polycotton sheets and treats requests for a duvet, though available with polycotton covers, as something of a customer quirk. Add to this some bedroom decor that is looking really dated.
reviews.title: Wonderful, charming hotel stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The good news is that the breakfasts are first class and the service therein is first class which is more than can be said for the evening meals. These had some good positives but a Sea Bass (nicely done) with an awful greasy sauce and tasteless ribbons of courgette and a Fillet Steak stated on the menu to be 'medium rare' and served as 'well done' suggested that all was not under control in the kitchen. Conversely, the Mallard and the Rabbit Terrine were very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 'Superior Rooms' at the front of the premises give a nice view of the local hills and in warmer weather their balconies would be a plus. Our bathroom was spacious and bedroom a reasonable size. The bed had his and hers mattresses but they wallowed. The shower lacked power.
reviews.title: Well run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As my boyfriend and I were unable to spend Christmas together we had a mid week break in December for our own little Christmas celebration. We've stayed at Rothay Manor a few years ago when we first met and had always vowed to go back. We stayed in the Wansfell suite which is in the grounds of the hotel. The suite is very spacious with a large seating area and a beautiful sleigh bed, there was a Christmas wreath on the front door of the suite and our very own little Christmas tree which was such a lovely touch, the bed was huge and extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Pre Christmas treat in the Wansfell suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have access to the local leisure club a couple of miles down the road which is a nice bonus, there is an outdoor hot-tub it was amazing to be sitting in it surrounded by snow in freezing temperatures.
reviews.title: twixmas at rothay is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food (both dinner and breakfast the next morning) was excellent and the staff are really helpful, friendly and attentive. The hotel has a real family feel and we will certainly be going back.
reviews.title: A most pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Rothay Manor hotel for the mid holiday break 27th to 30th of December we took the dinner bed and breakfast option and we did not regret it for a moment,the service was wonderful the food is great and over all it is a very pleasant experience. If I was to criticise any thing it would be the rooms which are very clean and tidy but looking a bit dated but then again perhaps this is part of the overall charm of the hotel,This was our third visit and we will definately be going back as we throughly enjoyed our stay
reviews.title: The best way to spend Christmas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don`t be confused by this being rated three star. My wife and I have stayed, over the years, at many hotels in the Lake District and these were mainly 4 and 5 star premises. Rothay Manor can compete with any of them especially for anyone looking for value for money.
reviews.title: Xmas Cheer

aka: Rothay Manor Hotel Ambleside, Lake District
description: The Rothay Manor Hotel & Restaurant offers a relaxed, warm and friendly atmosphere in a luxury country house setting, with large individually designed en-suite bedrooms, spacious comfortable lounges, delicious fresh food and outstanding service.We continue to maintain the standards and traditions that have kept the hotel a popular destination for over 40 years - well-appointed bedrooms, homemade jams and marmalades with breakfast, our famous buffet-style afternoon tea and our candle-lit restaurant, whilst offering modern amenities - flatscreen televisions, dvds, i-pod docks and free wi-fi.Open for Lunch and Dinner everyday, our delicious freshly cooked menu changes on a daily basis - or why not join us for our fabulous buffet Afternoon Tea.
